meanings.definition: Jolliers (noun): plural form of jollier, meaning a person who brings joy or happiness
meanings.sent1: The jolliers at the party had big smiles and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The jolliers in the neighborhood always spread happiness with their kind gestures.
meanings.sent3: The jolliers in the school play wore colorful costumes and brought cheer to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The jolliers in the office were like rays of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The jolliers in the park played music and danced, filling the air with joy.

meanings.definition: Jolliers (verb): third person present form of jolly, meaning to make someone happy or cheerful
meanings.sent1: She jolliers her little brother by telling funny jokes and playing games with him.
meanings.sent2: The clown jolliers the children at the birthday party with balloon animals and magic tricks.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jolliers the audience with his hilarious jokes and witty remarks.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to jolliers the soul and lift one's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The surprise gift jolliers her up instantly, turning her frown into a smile.
